page.title: 17The River Ouse
page.content: We have 3.750 km of river in our 12 km area.The River Ouse is fed by the rivers Swale Ure and Nidd .In the past the river was used for transporting goods but now it is used for fishing and pleasure boats{.Fishing}in the River Ouse is coarse fishing the main fish caught are gudgeon, chub, perch, dace and rudd.The bait used would be maggots,bread paste and worms,or red cheese.which is a favourite bait for chub The River Ouse is also used for {drinking water.}The water authority have a pumping station at Moor Monkton on the opposite bank to Beningbrough. Water is pumped out of the river into a lagoon to settle,then through a filter.It is then pumped through pipes to the resovoir in Leeds.
